page.title: 11FECKENHAM CHURCH
page.content: The church of St John the Baptist is situated on the village square in the village of Feckenham. Gypsy Rose Lee is supposed to be buried in the church yard. During the war, the railings round her grave were left alone, when all other metal in the grave yard was used for the war effort - the locals feared her curse. The church itself has a square Norman tower. There are eight bells in the belfry, two are supposed to be original.There used to be a pub in the village called The Eight Bells across the road from the church but this is now a private house.The old bells are still rung every Tuesday evening. There is a list of vicars of Feckenham inside the church going back to 1235.The present vicar is a deputy headmaster of a school in Birmingham as well as vicar of the Parish .
